version.xmlsource: This XML content was developed by AHRQ's contractor ECRI Institute for the National Quality Measures Clearinghouse (NQMC).

section.name: General
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
Self-injury: age-standardized rate of hospitalization in a general hospital due to self-injury per 100,000 population age 15 and older."/>

<fieldvalue value="
Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI). Indicator metadata: self-injury hospitalization. [internet]. Ottawa (ON): Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI); 2015 May [accessed 2015 Jul 13]. "/>

fieldvalue.value: Related Population Health Measures: Population Use of Services
Related Population Health Measure: Population Health State

section.name: Brief Abstract
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
This measure is used to assess the age-standardized rate of hospitalization in a general hospital due to self-injury per 100,000 population.
Calculation Description: (Total number of discharges for a self-injury for patients age 15 and older ÷ Total mid-year population age 15 and older) × 100,000 (age-adjusted)"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Self-injury is defined as a deliberate bodily injury that may or may not result in death. This type of injury is the result of either suicidal or self-harming behaviours, or both. Self-injury can be prevented, in many cases, by early recognition, intervention and treatment of mental illnesses. While some risk factors for self-injury are beyond the control of the health system, high rates of self-injury hospitalization can be interpreted as the result of a failure of the system to prevent self-injuries that are severe enough to require hospitalization."/>

<fieldvalue value="
Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI). Indicator metadata: self-injury hospitalization. [internet]. Ottawa (ON): Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI); 2015 May [accessed 2015 Jul 13]. "/> <fieldvalue value="
Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI). National Trauma Registry Analytic Bulletin: hospitalizations due to suicide attempts and self-inflicted injury in Canada, 2001-2002. Ottawa (ON): Canadian Institute for Health Information (CIHI); 2004. "/>

<fieldvalue value="
Self-injury; hospitalization"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Total mid-year population age 15 and older"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Total number of discharges for a self-injury for patients age 15 and older (see the related "Numerator Inclusions/Exclusions" field)"/>

section.name: Data Collection for the Measure
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
April 1 to March 31"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Inclusions
Total mid-year population age 15 and older
Exclusions
Unspecified"/>

<fieldvalue value="
Inclusions
Total number of discharges for a self-injury for patients age 15 and older
Include:
Self-injury is identified by external cause of injury codes with a diagnosis type of 9.
Note: Refer to the original measure documentation for the administrative codes.
Exclusions
Cases of self-injury involving outpatient treatment in hospital emergency departments or other medical facilities or completed suicide prior to hospital admission
Patients who were institutionalized in a psychiatric hospital and were self-injured during their stay but did not require admission to a general hospital
Cadaveric donor or stillbirth records (Admission Category = R or S) "/>

section.name: Computation of the Measure

fieldvalue.value: Does not apply to this measure
Does not apply to this measure (i.e., there is no pre-defined preference for the measure score)

field.name: Allowance for Patient or Population Factors
Description of Allowance for Patient or Population Factors

section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
Indicators are reported at the national, provincial/territorial, and regional levels.
Unless otherwise specified, for indicators based on place of residence, data is reported based on the region of the patient's residence, not region of hospitalization. Consequently, these figures reflect the hospitalization experience of residents of the region wherever they are treated, including out of province, as opposed to the comprehensive activity of the region's hospitals (that will also treat people from outside of the region). Hospitalizations occurring in the U.S. or abroad are not included.
For indicators based on place of service (where the patient was treated), data is reported based on the administrative region of the facility (e.g., region of hospitalization).
Rates are standardized or risk-adjusted wherever possible to facilitate comparability across provinces/regions/facilities and over time.
Standardized rates are adjusted by age (collapsed to five-year groupings) using a direct method of standardization based on the July 1, 1991, Canadian population. "/>

<fieldvalue value="
This NQMC summary was completed by ECRI Institute on March 18, 2013. The information was verified by the measure developer on May 17, 2013.
The CIHI informed NQMC that this measure was updated on October 31, 2013 and provided an updated version of the NQMC summary. This NQMC summary was reviewed and updated accordingly by ECRI Institute on February 21, 2014.
This NQMC summary was updated again by ECRI Institute on September 4, 2015. The information was verified by the measure developer on November 6, 2015.
The information was reaffirmed by the measure developer on April 29, 2016. "/>

<fieldvalue value="

Any use that is wholly or partly commercial in nature requires CIHI's express written permission.
Questions and inquiries may be directed to: CIHI, Health Indicators, 4110 Yonge Street, Suite 300, Toronto, Ontario, Canada, M2P 2B7; Phone: 416-481-2002; Fax: 416-481-2950."/>

section.name: Disclaimer
section.field:
<fieldvalue value="
The National Quality Measures Clearinghouse™ (NQMC) does not develop, produce, approve, or endorse the measures represented on this site.
All measures summarized by NQMC and hosted on our site are produced under the auspices of medical specialty societies, relevant professional associations, public and private organizations, other government agencies, health care organizations or plans, individuals, and similar entities.
Measures represented on the NQMC Web site are submitted by measure developers, and are screened solely to determine that they meet the NQMC Inclusion Criteria.
NQMC, AHRQ, and its contractor ECRI Institute make no warranties concerning the content or its reliability and/or validity of the quality measures and related materials represented on this site. Moreover, the views and opinions of developers or authors of measures represented on this site do not necessarily state or reflect those of NQMC, AHRQ, or its contractor, ECRI Institute, and inclusion or hosting of measures in NQMC may not be used for advertising or commercial endorsement purposes.
Readers with questions regarding measure content are directed to contact the measure developer."/>
